parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
(primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
